Opened issue "Merge cells in a Docx file." (#283) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: Hi, I have a problem with OpenXML version 2.5. I have created a table using rowspan and colspan. but while converting in Docx the display is getting changed. I am enclosing the HTML and screenshot of the output. If someone has any solution that would be a great help. Thank you, Venkata

Opened pull request "Keep WebExtensions parts" (#190) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
A simple solution to #189 which keeps the WebExtensions parts of the first document that has any.

It could be extended to merge the WebExtensions parts of all documents. Doing so would require copying over all the WebExtension parts and merging the content of the Taskpanes part, adjusting the reference IDs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "WebExtensions parts are not copied over by DocumentBuilder" (#189) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
From Office 2013, documents can contain WebExtensions parts (also known as [Office Web Extensibility Extensions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh695336.aspx)) which can link to Office Add-ins and specify taskpanes that are to be opened.

These WebExtensions parts are currently ignored by DocumentBuilder, but could be copied over instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "page-break-before not applied" (#188) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody: The tool of converting HTML to Docx supports page-break-before: always

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "DOCX to PDF" (#187) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,
I want to convert a DOCX file to PDF on any linux distribution you support. I just don't have a windows OS available. How can I do it. I've looked into the documentation and there is no trace of it.

Alternatively, is there a way to say which page contains a text fragment. For example, a text fragment has been identified on page number xx from the document yy,docx?

Thanks
